metadata.title: CVE-2022-41848 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - negligible
metadata.description: drivers/char/pcmcia/synclink_cs.c in the Linux kernel through 5.19.12 has arace condition and resultant use-after-free if a physically proximateattacker removes a PCMCIA device while calling ioctl, aka a race conditionbetween mgslpc_ioctl and mgslpc_detach.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
